newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan to tender for 108,000T US or Argentine corn.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan to tender for 108,000T US or Argentine corn.

text.p: Taiwan's CK group will tender on Tuesday for two 54,000-tonne shipments of U.S. No.2 or Argentine corn, traders said on Monday.
The CK Group comprises Chia Hsin Flour Feed and Vegetable Oil Corp and some buyers from Taiwan's southern port city of Kaohsiung.
Taiwan buyers, who generally favour U.S. grain, have taken a new interest in Argentine corn for April and May shipments due to a recent bully rally in U.S. corn futures, traders said.
"The recent rise of U.S. corn prices made Argentine corn more attractive to Taiwan buyers," a trader said.
Taiwan buyers would consider to buy Argentine corn if the price was US$10 or more below the U.S. corn price, he said.
Details for the Tuesday tender are as follows, with possible shipment from the U.S. Gulf of Mexico, the Pacific Northwest or Argentina:
U.S. Gulf Pacific N.W. Argentine port
